original_title: Sri Lanka stocks surge after limited DDR
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s stock surged around 4.5 percent in the first hour of trading Tuesday as markets opened after a domestic debt re-structuring last week excluded banks and other bondholders.
The Colombo All Share Index gained around 450 points in the first hours.

Hatton National Bank was up 10 rupees to 118 rupees, Sampath up 8.30 to 64.20 rupees, Commercial Bank up 10.60 rupees to 78.70 rupees, DFCC up 5.10 rupees to 51.70 rupees, NDB up 7.00 rupees to 57.00 in intra day trade.
Ceylon Tobacco was up 29.75 to 850 rupees despite a tax hike.
Sri Lanka bond yields plunge 10 to 12-pct without DDR premium
Sri Lanka bond yields also plunged over 10 percent in a historic fall. (Colombo/July04/2023)
